headline.main: TREATMENT NEEDS OF ALCOHOLIC WOMEN STUDIED

docs.lead_paragraph: Women should be given different treatment for alcoholism than men because women become alcoholics at lower levels of consumption, are quicker to develop related diseases and drink for different reasons, a researcher says. Differences in the metabolism and psychology of women drinkers suggest that they may be more susceptible to alcohol addiction and more vulnerable to its effects than men, said the researcher, Sheila Blume of the State University of New York at Stony Brook. ''What it comes down to is women alcoholics drink less but get sick more,'' she said in a telephone interview Friday.
